author: david_m77
title: A decent enough small car build, but not a great set...
review:
Although it was a staple for quite some time, the ~5 USD Creator set disappeared with little fanfare after 2017. While small, sets like this allowed for some really fantastic car builds in a really tiny and inexpensive space, like the slightly dorky-looking 31055 Red Racer and its amazing elder, 31027 Blue Racer, which even managed to have an opening rear engine hatch. Even the polybag sets had some charm to them, like 30187 Fast Car and 30183 Little Car.

However, this set takes a different approach. And maybe it's not for the best...

The set takes more of a Tiny Turbos approach to building, with SNOT brackets used to create the bumpers and side panels. A Racers piece also serves as the front fascia. Two new cutout half-arches are used to round out the roofline, with the cutouts perfectly accommodating the rear fenders. A pair of new round tiles with pins compose the tailpipes. What makes this little set really notable is the use of azure blue for the highlights, which is a very pleasant surprise.

However, this Race Car seems to have taken all the wrong notes from the Tiny Turbos era. Although it appears to be an LMP style racer, the parts used in the car's midsection and fenders give it an extremely bulky profile, making it look more like a strangely low slung pickup truck or cabin-forward muscle car. In addition, while previous Creator mini cars have featured brick-built head and taillights (31000 Mini Speeder stands out as a gorgeous example,) this set has no taillights and only a specialized front fender to do so.

While this Race Car may scratch an itch for a small Creator car build, it is by no means the best work of the theme.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Race along with LEGO Creator
review:
Set #30572 Race Car: A LEGO Polybag from Creator is often miniature models from LEGO designers that specialize in capturing the likenesses of larger models. It has been done before, when it comes to this set I cannot speak for that as I typically do not collect larger Creator sets. So forgive me if this model is based on a larger model from one of the 3-in-1 buildable vehicle sets.

What I can speak on is the pros and cons of this set and its overall look and feel as a buildable model.

Pros:

  • Large satisfying build with numerous elements.
  • Fun model, great for racing and playing alongside past race cars from LEGO Creator.
  • Solid use of parts and good price-per-piece ratio.

Cons:

  • Limited availability. Meaning difficult to find at retail in North America since Toy’s-R-Us closed down. Wal-Mart Canada has picked up the Polybag tab, but it is still difficult to get as they don’t seem to order nearly the same numbers or keep products around as often as TRU used to.

Overall opinion

This is a hefty chunky little model that is great fun. It was extremely enjoyable to build and I love the red and light blue colour palette. I’d recommend picking this up if you can find it in North America, as it makes for a great solid build and a fun gift for a good report card.
